Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 50th overall pick, by Philadelphia in 1965...
Traded from Philadelphia to Los Angeles (N) on 4/1/1965 (Going to LAN: CF A. Phillips, P W. Granger, P P. Edmondson, P J. James. Going to PHI: P S. Koufax, P P. Richert, SS M. Wills)...
Injured on 5/29/1967 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 4 days...
Injured on 7/25/1968 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for 5-6 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/8/1969, off Jim McAndrew (SF)...
Earned first career win on 4/14/1969...
Injured on 9/5/1969 with a Herniated Disc Back, out for 7 weeks...
Injured on 5/5/1971 with a Sore Back, out for one week...
Won World Series with Los Angeles in 1971...
Signed as a free agent by Baltimore on 2/5/1975 to a 2-year deal worth $5,560,000 per year...
Traded from Baltimore to Houston on 7/31/1975 (Going to HOU: P W. Granger. Going to BAL: RF G. Hendrick)...
